DOCNAME: CASE OF ŠTERJOV AND OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicants’ personal details are listed in the appendix below .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL people ( “ the predecessors ” ) , the ninth and the CARDINAL applicants initiated civil proceedings for determination of title to plots of land .

CARDINAL . DATE the predecessors died . The first , second , third and fourth applicants stepped in the proceedings on behalf of their late predecessor . The fifth to eighth and the tenth to CARDINAL applicants did not step in the proceedings on behalf of their late predecessors .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ninth applicant died .
CARDINAL . On DATE the CARDINAL applicant died and his heirs , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , applied to continue the application in his name .
CARDINAL . On DATE the fourth applicant died and her heirs , the second and third applicants , applied to continue the application also in her name .

CARDINAL . The impugned proceedings , which were reconsidered on CARDINAL occasion , ended on DATE when the final decision of ORG was served on the applicants . This decision listed the following as plaintiffs : the first , second , third , fourth , ninth and CARDINAL applicants as well as the predecessors of the remaining applicants .
